main event: On November 3, 1955, in Malad City, Idaho, an initial flash attracted the observer's attention, followed by the appearance of an object that seemed to explode. The trajectory course was southerly, and it was later concluded to likely be a meteor observation.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only a few seconds, indicating a brief and sudden event.
The report suggests that the observed object was an explosion or possibly a meteor.
The document includes detailed weather conditions at the time of the sighting, indicating thorough record-keeping.
The involvement of military personnel is evident from the document's formatting and terminology.
The conclusion lists possibilities like 'Balloon,' 'Aircraft,' 'Meteor,' and 'Unknown,' illustrating the uncertainty surrounding the sighting.
sighted object: initial flash and exploding object, likely a meteor
witnesses: Observer reported by O/S Observation, Lt. Trafford, and Capt.
